title: Generate Commit Message and Commit
description: Analyze diffs and create proper conventional commits automatically.

prompt.content:
Analyze all modified files and their diffs.

1. Identify:
- What changed
- Why it changed
- Which feature/module it belongs to
- Side effects (UI, API, workflows, docs, translations)

2. Generate a commit message using:

<type>(<scope>): <short summary>

Body:
- Describe what changed and why
- List key files touched
- Mention required docs or translation updates if needed

Allowed types: feat, fix, refactor, docs, test, chore, style, perf, ci

Rules:
- Be specific, never vague.
- No filler text.
- If change affects workflows/statuses/modals/backend logic â†’ mention in body.

3. Output ONLY the commit message. NOTHING else.

4. Then automatically commit using:

```
git add -A
git commit -m "<generated message>"
```
